content: Sure! The Stećci Medieval Tombstones Graveyards is a UNESCO World Heritage site comprising 28 sites across Bosnia and Herzegovina, western Serbia, eastern and southern Croatia, and Montenegro. The graveyards contain over 70,000 medieval tombstones, which date from the 12th to 16th centuries. The tombstones are unique in their style and are decorated with ornaments and carvings that tell stories of the time when they were made. The site is significant for its cultural and artistic value and provides insight into the medieval period of the Balkans. Some of the most famous Stećci graveyards are in Radimlja, Cista Velika, and Boljuni, all located in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
